summary.para: Called by the browser when the browser cannot determine the protocol of a URL address. This method uses a search context to determine the protocol.

param.name: pwszSearchURL
param.para: The address of a wide character buffer that, on entry, contains the URL address for which the browser is trying to determine the protocol. On exit, this buffer contains the modified URL address if the method was successful.

param.name: cchBufferSize
param.para: The size, in characters, of the buffer at lpwszSearchURL.

param.name: pSearchContext
param.para: A pointer to an object. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes a method that is used by the browser to translate the address of an unknown URL protocol by using a search context object.

remarks.para: This interface also provides the methods of the interface, from which it inherits.

When attempting to browse to a URL address, if the browser retrieves an IURLSearchHook2 interface, a search context is passed to the browser. If no IURLSearchHook2 interface is available the browser uses to determine the address of the unknown URL.
